page.title: 08SCHOOL BUSES FROM TUNSTALL
page.content: The children of Tunstall have to travel to their schools as there are no education establishments in the village. The juniors receive their primary education at the modern day school at Catterick Village, the seniors choose to attend the comprehensive school at either Catterick Garrison or at Richmond. The children in outlying districts are brought to school by taxi. The North Yorkshire Education Authority pay towards the cost of travelling expenses if the children attend the school nearest to their home. If the parents choose to send their children to a day school further away from home then they must pay the bill themselves. The children receive a good all round education with computers being introduced in all schools.
